roleset.name: get from predecessor

example.name: no predecessor
example.text: Taking over as chief executive officer in 1983 , he inherited a company that was mired in debt and hurt by a recession - inspired slide in its building - products business .

propbank.arg: Taking over as chief executive officer in 1983
a company that was mired in debt and hurt by a recession - inspired slide in its building - products business

example.name: all args
example.text: Dr. Knudson found that some children with the eye cancer had inherited a damaged copy of chromosome No . 13 from a parent who had had the disease .

propbank.arg: some children with the eye cancer
a damaged copy of chromosome No . 13
from a parent who had had the disease

example.name: passive
example.text: Like all genes , tumor - suppressor genes are inherited in two copies , one from each parent .

propbank.arg: in two copies , one from each parent

example.name: args 0, 1
example.text: Gloucester ends up thinking that his legitimate son , Edgar , has been scheming to kill him in order to hasten his inheritance of Gloucester 's wealth and lands .

example.name: NOT EVENTIVE. .YY!
example.text: When he donated his inheritance of $ 1 million , what was his net worth ?

example.name: with arg2 and oblique arg0
example.text: What is the role of protein in the inheritance of genes from parents to offspring ?

roleset.note: INHERIT-V NOTES: Frames file for 'inherit' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entry 13.5.2. (from inherit.01-v predicate notes)
INHERITANCE-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT, inherit.01, WN sense #1. Corresponds to VNcls obtain-13.5.2. (from inheritance.01-n)
watch out for usages that describe the thing obtained itself, rather than the act of obtaining. These are not eventive! (from inheritance.01-n)
